experiences.role: Software Development Engineer Intern - Selling Partner Financial Technology
highlights: Cut support tickets by 90% and saved 133 hours/year by building an internal tool for merchant reclassification
Reduced 0.25 FTE of engineering effort by consolidating two legacy systems into a unified web interface
Built an AI agent to detect and fix stuck financial transactions, eliminating 70+ hours/year of manual effort
Redesigned LLM citation handling to support streaming, increasing multi-source citation rate by 161% and contributing to a 62% reduction in response latency
Developed Langfuse metrics in Python to assess LLM attribution, categorization, and quality, using insights to guide prompt tuning and improve citation accuracy
Reduced response time by 53% on repeated sales tip queries by reusing precomputed recommendations
Increased recall of smaller LLMs by 64% through prompt tuning experiments targeting sales use cases
Built and deployed two serverless AI chatbots using AWS CDK for student support and public digital services, enabling 24/7 course Q&A and strategy feedback
Enabled multi-tenant RAG with PGVector, cutting LLM response times by 25% in LangChain pipelines
Reduced infrastructure costs by $3197 USD/year by optimizing deployment architecture across chatbot services
Supervised labs for over 250 undergraduate students, offering guidance during labs and feedback on problem sets

projects.name: BThere
projects.subtitle: BThere is a web app that remembers your friends' names and past conversations, detects how they're feeling, and helps you support them when they're down or deepen your bond when they're doing well

projects.name: Focusaurus
projects.subtitle: Focusaurus is a Chrome extension designed to keep you healthy, productive, and mindful as you navigate your online life

projects.name: SleepCode
projects.subtitle: SleepCode is a platform for practicing JavaScript coding challenges

projects.name: MO:NT
projects.subtitle: MO:NT is a mobile application designed to support the mental health of individuals with muscular dystrophy by enabling them to track their emotions based on location

projects.name: Ecoglo
projects.subtitle: EcoGlo is a Chrome extension for Sephora that assesses beauty product sustainability through ingredient analysis, aiming to empower informed consumer choices

projects.name: Alexandria
projects.subtitle: Alexandria is a PDF document management app powered by AI that converts PDFs into embeddings using OpenAI and Pinecone for efficient querying. It facilitates the retrieval of specific information and explores capabilities such as generating practice questions from analyzed content

projects.name: Wanderers hub
projects.subtitle: Wanderer's Hub is an AI-powered travel app that provides personalized recommendations based on user preferences
projects.period: CrackedDevs X Astra X APEERS Hackathon 2024

projects.name: Brain Stroke Prediction
projects.subtitle: This project focuses on forecasting strokes by using data preprocessing, exploratory analysis, and various machine learning models

kiroves.about: I study math and computer science at the University of British Columbia. I previously worked as a software development engineer intern at Amazon!

profile.name: Garreth Edderick Lee
profile.headline: ML Engineer. I build stuff with AI & data and write about what I learned.

highlights: Improved text extraction for future Fineweb datasets
Tokenizer experiments for mathematical reasoning and detailed report
Internal tools for visualizing & inspecting LLM pretraining data
On‑call ticket routing: 40%→80% accuracy
Improved PII scrubber coverage for LLM gateway
Auto‑update pipeline for in‑house vector DB
Terabyte‑scale pretraining data pipelines
LLM pipeline for document quality evaluation
Language ID integration for HTML parsing (quality ↑)

projects.name: Email Generation Model Fine‑tuning
projects.subtitle: PEFT, Python, Ollama, Transformers
details: Fine‑tuned Mistral 7B to streamline initial email drafts for UBC Biztech's partnerships team
End‑to‑end dataset preparation for training with high‑quality inputs
Deployed locally with Ollama for optimized inference and data control

writings.title: From Digits to Decisions: How Tokenization Impacts Arithmetic in LLMs
writings.description: I explore how right-to-left reading improves number tokenization and identify the most accurate method for arithmetic

writings.title: Finetuning a Large Language Model to Write Emails
writings.description: I finetune an LLM to write emails for my school club

garrethlee.about: Previously @ Cohere, Hugging Face, and Wealthsimple.
garrethlee.workingOn: Building Mundo AI (YC W25) | Data Layer for Multilingual AI

projects.name: Aedifex
projects.subtitle: Breaks down Minecraft build recipes into their constituent materials. Helpful when you're building and crafting and you want to bring the exact amount you need.

projects.name: Cenxur
projects.subtitle: Uses a Naive Bayes classifer to flag inappropriate messages in Discord, to relieve moderator workload. The classifier was implemented fully manually.

projects.name: Goblet
projects.subtitle: A lightweight locally hosted video sharing solution built using Python, JS, Flask, and HTML/CSS. My friends and I wanted to watch movies and TV shows together over the pandemic. This project's key technology is SocketIO, which you can read about how I dealt with the challenges of synchronizing videos across the internet here.

projects.name: Stride
projects.subtitle: My team and I created an Android app that identified people based on their walking patterns using machine learning models trained with data gathered from phone accelerometers.

projects.name: TrafficSim
projects.subtitle: At the Greater Vancouver Regional Science Fair 2018, I built a platform for rapidly testing road formations for better traffic flow using Processing Java.

frankwhoee.about: I find no greater satisfaction than in the process of creation: Creating art, cooking food, writing code. Our purpose on Earth is to see ourselves reflected in the products of our labour, so I hope that at the end of it all, when all is said and done, we will gaze upon the things we have built, the art that we have made, and the people that we have loved—and find ourselves there.

projects.name: Atelier
projects.subtitle: The Vancouver node of Socratica. My co-hosts and I run 2 weekly co-working sessions for 30+ people to work on their passion projects. I vibe-engineer the space, building both people and software infrastructure to help creativity and connection thrive.

projects.name: Dot Counter
projects.subtitle: Click to count items in images with colored dots to keep track of your progress and get an instant total

projects.name: Link Sanitizer
projects.subtitle: A mobile app that removes trackers from links.

projects.name: Unveiler.xyz
projects.subtitle: A web app to bring awareness to the privacy implications of poorly censored images.

projects.name: Reorderable
projects.subtitle: A simple library that enable drag-and-drop reordering in lists in Jetpack Compose and Kotlin Compose Multiplatform.

projects.name: Orbital Flush
projects.subtitle: A toilet that flushes whenever an astronaut aboard the International Space Station (ISS) flushes. It's mounted on a rotating platform that tracks the ISS as it orbits Earth.

projects.name: Unscannable QR Code
projects.subtitle: A QR code you can see but not scan. This piece was displayed at the QR Show at the The Recurse Center.

projects.name: Clicka!
projects.subtitle: An absurdly simple yet addictive game, it involves a counter rising with each click, alongside a timer tracking your total game time. With each click, enjoy satisfying sound effects and visual ripples, celebrate milestones with confetti showers, unlock achievements, and compare your stats with players worldwide.
details: 282k+ downloads on the App Store with 4.8★

projects.name: CalcGPT.io
projects.subtitle: An amusing web app, satirizing the trend of employing advanced GPT large language models for trivial tasks. It depicts a simple calculator with adjustable "Temperature" and "Top P" sliders, embodying a comical way to control overkill AI functionalities. This project humorously illustrates the potential redundancy of next-generation AI for straightforward tasks, serving as a lighthearted critique of the tech industry's novelty obsession.

projects.name: SecretDrop.io
projects.subtitle: A web app designed to establish secure communication in public domain. It generates encryption and decryption links, allowing texts and files to be safely shared. Developed out of a real-life need to send private messages on public forums, SecretDrop.io democratizes public key cryptography. Ideal for anyone looking to securely communicate over public platforms.

projects.name: DEF CON 32 Badge Flashy ROM
projects.subtitle: A GameBoy ROM that runs on the DEF CON 32 badge, flashes all the LEDs.

projects.name: Big Weigh
projects.subtitle: A daily game where you guess the price of stranger's Big Way.

projects.name: Webpack Image Loaders
projects.subtitle: A suite of 6 loaders for the Webpack JavaScript bundler that offers features like thumbnail creation, dominant color extraction for pre-loading previews, and generating differently sized images for responsive design. These project enhances image loading efficiency, saving bandwidth and reducing loading times for an improved user experience.

projects.name: view-transition-name
projects.subtitle: A JavaScript library that format strings to valid css `view-transition-name`s

projects.name: toggleairport
projects.subtitle: A script for macOS to turn off WiFi when Ethernet is plugged in, and turn on WiFi when Ethernet is unplugged.

projects.name: AutoLinkText
projects.subtitle: A simple library that makes links, emails, and phone numbers clickable in text in Jetpack Compose and Kotlin Compose Multiplatform.

projects.name: is-even-ai
projects.subtitle: A library that checks number parity with AI.

projects.name: Kitsilano School App
projects.subtitle: A multifunctional iOS and Android application I created in high school. This app was designed to keep students updated about upcoming school events and homework assignments. Additionally, it offers a platform for administrators, teachers, and clubs to share events, send out notifications, and disseminate news, ensuring efficient and seamless communication within the school community.
details: Media Appearances: The Vancouver Sun, CBC

projects.name: Kitsilano Secondary Heritage Tour
projects.subtitle: A virtual journey through the historic Kitsilano Secondary School, created before its destructive renovation. The project serves as a digital time capsule, preserving the walls that bore witness to countless student memories. Designed in collaboration with my arts teacher Mr.Mehl during my time at the school.
details: Media Appearances: Global News, Sing Tao Daily

projects.name: USB Morse Code Key
projects.subtitle: A project that breathes life into a historical communication method, marrying it with modern hardware and software to forge an interactive, functional tool. It's more than just a historical novelty; it yields practical use. Perfect for Morse Code enthusiasts and history buffs.

projects.name: Hot Words on Reddit
projects.subtitle: A web app that leverages natural language processing and sentiment analysis to creates interactive word clouds that visually represent the most discussed topics on Reddit. Each word's sentiment is intuitively color-coded, with a scale from green (positive) to red (negative). By providing a real-time snapshot of trending conversations, Hotwords of Reddit serves as a unique tool for understanding public sentiment on various issues.

projects.name: Kitsilano Grad Composite Gallery
projects.subtitle: A web app designed for Kitsilano Secondary School alumni. It serves as a digital yearbook, offering an online space for alumni to reminisce and reconnect with their high school days.

projects.name: Martini Call Blocker
projects.subtitle: An Android app that offers robust call blocking for intrusive spam calls. Utilizing the new STIR/SHAKEN protocol mechanisms, it ensures users receive only authenticated calls.

projects.name: NaviChat
projects.subtitle: An innovative way-finding kiosk designed for Emily Carr University to guide students and visitors alike. Combining a large touchscreen display with an integrated voice assistant, it provides an interactive experience of location search. Running on a Raspberry Pi and powered by Electron, the software includes 500 context-aware dialogs for voice-activated queries. Users can conveniently search for direction by typing or speaking, effectively simplifying campus navigation.

projects.name: RPi-MFRC522
projects.subtitle: A driver written in C++ for MFRC522 RFID card readers that exposes them to the Node.js runtime.

projects.name: Touch ID Box
projects.subtitle: A 3D printed enclosure that transform your Apple Magic Keyboard into a standalone Touch ID button.

projects.name: 3D Barge Model
projects.subtitle: A 3D model of the English Bay barge that washed ashore in Vancouver, BC, Canada in November 2021.

projects.name: Barrelfish
projects.subtitle: Redesigned and re-implemented parts of the experimental operating system, Barrelfish, originally developed by ETH Zurich and Microsoft Research, to explore the frontier of multikernel and heterogeneous hardware approaches

projects.name: Peer-to-Peer Isolation-Aware Value Access Network - P2P IVAN
projects.subtitle: A distributed, peer-to-peer, fault-tolerant, and scalable key-value store.

projects.name: Currentcy
projects.subtitle: A Wear OS (Android) and watchOS (Apple Watch) complication that shows the exchange rate of the currency of the user's current location to the user's home currency.

writings.title: The Fed says this is a cube of $1M. They're off by half a million.

calvin-ll.about: I'm a software engineer based in Vancouver, BC. I build mobile apps, web apps, and open source libraries. I'm passionate about privacy, security, and creating tools that help people.
